name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Today I announced that Hawaiʻi is dropping its mask mandate in outdoor settings – effective immediately. This is across all islands. I spoke with county mayors and we agree this is the right next step. We’ve been seeing fewer cases of COVID and have made progress on vaccinations.  https://t.co/baxuwwlNcD

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Mahalo to Hawaiʻi’s paramedics and EMTs who care for our residents and visitors in critical times of need. Over the last year these frontline workers have also put their own health and safety at risk during COVID-19 pandemic. Thank you for all you do! #NationalEMSWeek  https://t.co/F2FQE3pzvq

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: When the COVID-19 pandemic hit, many people had to work from home or go to school virtually, highlighting how important internet access is. Unfortunately, many struggled to pay for that service. The new Emergency Broadband Benefit Program (EBB) can help.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Hawaiʻi is well on its way to reaching @POTUS new goal. 49% of the state’s population has received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose, 39% are fully vaccinated. If you want to get the COVID-19 vaccine, you can make an appointment or find a walk-in clinic:  https://t.co/WnGlb3i2rj

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Life can get busy, but nothing is more important than your health. If you’re interested in getting a COVID-19 vaccine, I encourage you to make it a priority and schedule an appointment at  https://t.co/mOGhiMON7i or visit one of the many vaccination clinics taking walk-ins.  https://t.co/RFxPYM8MKF

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: @1maxImus10 Aloha! Anyone not vaccinated may choose to get a COVID test, if the result is negative they can also bypass quarantine (this includes kids). However, note that if your child is under 5 they do not need either a test or vaccine and can bypass quarantine. Mahalo!

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: @shamwowGoon Aloha! We respect your right to choose to get vaccinated or not. You can still get a COVID test to bypass quarantine. Mahalo!

reply_to.name: The AP has fact checked this tweet to be true.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Our state has been doing well in keeping COVID cases steady & our hospitalizations low, & we are ready to take this next step. I know how important for residents to be able to travel to see their friends & family on other islands & this provides a way for them to do that safely.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Travelers will still need to create a Safe Travels Hawaiʻi account and check county websites for additional requirements. Those who aren’t vaccinated may bypass quarantine if they get a negative COVID-19 test result from a trusted travel partner.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: @IsisEssentials Aloha! DOH reported yesterday that 38 people who have been fully vaccinated have gotten COVID-19 in Hawaii. No deaths were reported from that number. Mahalo!

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: @SparkBibo Aloha, about 33% of the population now has at least one dose of the COVID vaccine (22% estimated completed). We hope that more people will sign up as eligibility continues to expand. You can see all the stats here:  https://t.co/zm3YJQgKal

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Hawaii has reached a huge milestone! One million doses of the COVID vaccine administered here in the state. Eligibility to get the vaccine on Oahu remains at 50+, but DOH is tracking to open that up to those 16+ by next week. All other islands have opened eligibility to 16+.  https://t.co/5zrEvRet9k

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Interested in getting a COVID-19 test? DOH is offering free rapid testing in Palolo Valley at Jarrett Middle School this Friday from 4:30 – 7:00 pm, and 9:00 am to 1:00 pm on Sunday. There’s free parking, and results will take about 30 minutes.  https://t.co/MQzRLZ6wOp

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: DOH is expanding COVID-19 vaccine eligibility to Oʻahu residents age 50 and up beginning Monday. The DOH is also tracking @POTUS deadline to open eligibility up to those 16 and older by April 19.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: It's been a tough year for Hawai‘i and everywhere else in the world. But with our COVID-19 precautions, more people getting vaccinated and the American Rescue Plan on the way, the future is looking brighter. So what will the future look like in a Hawai‘i 2.0 economy?  https://t.co/qA0U4w0f3q

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: I’m pleased to announce beginning Monday, those 60 and older will now be eligible to get the COVID-19 vaccine. The state has been working to get residents vaccinated quickly and we continue to be ranked one of the top states by the CDC for administering vaccine doses per capita.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Hawaii hit 122 COVID-19 cases today. We've been doing well the last couple weeks, but this is a good reminder for everyone to wear your masks, wash your hands, and watch your distance. This cluster report shows where some of the cases have popped up in the last two weeks.  https://t.co/9Zm3L5hjHJ

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: A huge mahalo to @Zippys for helping to keep Hawaii residents safe. The “AlohaSafe Alert,” app, launched by DOH, lets you know if you’ve come into contact with someone who later tests positive for COVID-19. Zippy’s has offered a 25% off discount on breakfast bentos ... (1/2)

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: @Chris71062398 You're right, it does help. Though the efficacy is 95% -meaning there is always a small chance someone could still contract COVID, but they will likely have little to no symptoms. The hope again, is to avoid hospitalizations and deaths. Mahalo.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: @Chris71062398 The vaccine can help prevent serious hospitalizations and deaths if someone were to get COVID-19. The hope is to keep people, like your wife, as safe as possible.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: @Chris71062398 Hi Chris, it's difficult to pinpoint a specific reason because I'm not sure about the details surrounding your wife's case. That said, the COVID-19 vaccine can help prevent someone from getting COVID, but it does not eliminate the risk completely.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: For kupuna who need help registering for the COVID-19 vaccine, the “kupuna call center” has been launched. It's open daily from 7 am - 10 pm. Specialists can help them navigate registration, get an appointment, and arrange for transportation. The number to call is 2-1-1.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Has your income been negatively affected by COVID-19? SNAP can help you buy food for times like this. Learn more at  https://t.co/GkWBZ7QpBt #hawaiidepartmentofhumanservices #ohanahuistrong

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: @SparkBibo Aloha, here is a link to the CDC’s COVID data tracker with a breakdown of administered vaccine doses:  https://t.co/dxU4WDKlzB

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: If you’re interested, free COVID-19 tests are available. DOH partnered with UH to offer 150 COVID tests at its West Oahu campus today and tomorrow between 9 am-2 pm. Free parking is available and you’ll get your results on-site. You can view more here:  https://t.co/QHsUCHhLeU

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: It would be an understatement to say COVID-19 has changed everything – including going virtual nearly 24/7. However, the transition hasn't been easy for everyone and the pandemic has shown gaps of digital inequity. The “Broadband Hui” aims to help:  https://t.co/2JrGzJ30wi

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Hawai‘i is one of nine states that has been awarded a grant to accelerate COVID-19 workforce recovery efforts. The $84k grant will ultimately help job seekers connect with training resources, education, job opportunities and essential support services.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: I’m excited to announce that furloughs and layoffs for state workers are no longer necessary now that President Joe Biden has signed the $1.9T American Rescue Plan, known as the COVID-19 relief bill. Hawai‘i will receive a total of $2.2 billion. (1/3)

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: DOH has found a new South African variant in an Oahu resident with no travel history. I’ll be discussing that and other COVID-19 updates happening in the state right now on @StarAdvertiser   To watch:   https://t.co/XxjYG4aLnX

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: First Johnson & Johnson Vaccine Administered: DOH has begun administering Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccines in Hawaii. The first shipment of the vaccine arrived on Wednesday and was given to hundreds of DOE employees today in Kaneohe.   To read more:  https://t.co/vEdwr9UkvS

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Due to the low number of recent COVID-19 cases, Kauai County will be re-joining the state’s Safe Travels program. The county previously opted out in December 2020, due to a high volume of COVID-19 cases and to avoid overwhelming its hospitals (1/2).

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: DOH is reporting 20 new cases of the coronavirus today, which is the lowest statewide case count since late July 2020. Hawaii residents have been doing their part to keep COVID-19 cases down, and this is an example of their sacrifices and efforts.   https://t.co/NBKos1sz0H

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Businesses are invited to apply for e-commerce and digital marketing support funded by the Hawai‘i Business Pivot Grant program. The program matches companies with consultants to help improve the company’s digital presence during COVID-19. To read more:   https://t.co/DHmk2qRfqg

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Vaccine Delivery Update:  DOH is anticipating delivery of 67,280 doses of COVID-19 vaccines this week. This includes 28,080 doses of Pfizer vaccines, 27,300 doses of Moderna vaccines, and 11,900 doses of Johnson & Johnson vaccines.    https://t.co/Abc2z1GzYo

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: DOH’s State Laboratories Division (SLD) confirms the presence of a new COVID variant in Hawai‘i. The P.2 variant, which contains the E484K mutation, was identified through surveillance testing conducted on O‘ahu.   Click the link below to read more.   https://t.co/cHDn9LFLqq  https://t.co/ii8nZbr02s

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Gov. David Ige participated in the National Governors’ Association’s virtual Winter Meeting this week, to discuss efforts to end the COVID-19 public health crisis and debate ways to ensure a strong and equitable economic recovery.  Click the link.   https://t.co/5jE66dsHu9  https://t.co/zKgx7U18nJ

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Met with @Potus & @SecretaryPete during the @NatlGovsAssoc winter mtg to discuss efforts to end the COVID-19 public health crisis and debate ways to ensure a strong and equitable economic recovery.  https://t.co/IGnkY1qLVq

tweet: Gov. David Ige has issued an 18th emergency proclamation for COVID-19, extending the eviction moratorium for another 60 days.    https://t.co/JU9VkCy3mI

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Mask-wearing is one of the single most effective measures for preventing COVID-19 infection. Mask fits well—snug over the nose and mouth, from the bridge of the nose to under the chin. Made of at least two layers of cloth or medical mask material.   https://t.co/BgmM7NOsVW  https://t.co/mmK4JMgO5g

tweet: 91% of respondents in a recent statewide survey plan to get the COVID-19 vaccine, a strong indication that attitudes about the vaccine are rapidly shifting since administration of the vaccinations first began in mid-December.   https://t.co/dvYW4FpkTq

tweet: At a news conference this afternoon Governor David Ige provided an update on Hawai‘i’s current financial picture, the near-term outlook, and post COVID-19 pandemic predictions.   https://t.co/j4k44CGhNb

tweet: People Encouraged to Review 2021 Special Enrollment Period for Comprehensive Health Care Coverage  Starting Feb. 15, 2021, and continuing through May 15, 2021,  https://t.co/vKKjhdx4Au will make a SEP available in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.    https://t.co/8e8pe6W1LG  https://t.co/EEMiWYxbUM

tweet: DLNR is sending a reminder that commercial vessels, regardless of size, are required to ensure that all their passengers and crew wear masks to prevent the spread of COVID-19.  Click the link below to read more.   https://t.co/iGgeIlF8iJ

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: WATCH: Spoke with @Microsoft President Brad Smith & Gov @DougBurgum about broadband availability, data’s role in improving COVID-19 healthcare response, how technology has aided innovation during #pandemic  https://t.co/R4WdV5sRqF @BradSmi @westgov

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: #Hawaii’s first shipment of COVID-19 vaccines arrived at The Queen’s Medical Center in Honolulu this morning. This initial delivery of 975 does of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine marks an important milestone in the ongoing effort to combat #COVID19 and return life to normal.  https://t.co/gkma3Jhs4W

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Safe and effective COVID-19 vaccine arriving in Hawai‘i   https://t.co/MMe7HoXiD6

tweet: RT @CDCgov: Help #FightFlu this season! Your #fluvaccine protects you and can also help protect essential workers and save medical resources for the care of COVID-19 patients.   Learn more:  https://t.co/mI3N8BjBWQ.  https://t.co/QY6dU0ngHu

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: The first phase of Hawai‘i’s COVID-19 Vaccination Plan is divided into three groups:  Phase 1a – Essential healthcare workers  Phase 1b – Essential workers  Phase 1c – 65 years and older and adults with high-risk medical conditions   Details:  https://t.co/FyT6fvc43c

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: "Just hours ago, the FDA’s committee of experts voted overwhelmingly in favor to recommend Emergency Use Authorization of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine. We are optimistic that the FDA will grant the Emergency Use Authorization soon,” said Dr. Char.  https://t.co/2CufCuAOoc

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Today we laid out the first steps of #HawaiiCOVID19 vaccination effort, including plans to distribute an expected 81,000 doses of COVID-19 vaccinations in the month of December to high-risk health care workers and long-term care facilities across the state  https://t.co/FyT6fvc43c  https://t.co/NuffMounl6

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: I issued a 15th COVID-19 emergency proclamation that extends and clarifies the statewide mask mandate as agreed to by all four counties and the state.  https://t.co/cPWi7p61Dj

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: RT @Hawaii_EMA: Mainland ICU capacities have dropped to dangerous levels and Hawai’i’s new COVID case numbers are creeping up again. Wear your mask over both nose and mouth, practice social distancing, watch hands often, and minimize gatherings.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: The federal government has approved my request for an extension of funding that will allow the Hawai‘i National Guard to continue with COVID-19 assistance across the state through March 31, 2021.   https://t.co/WKGw929a3W

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: For parents left unemployed due to COVID-19, getting a free breakfast and lunch for their children can make a big difference. We're urging families to take advantage of the free Grab-and-Go meals being offered across the state through 12/18. Learn more:  https://t.co/twQDUm6bhB

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: A glimpse into the life of nurses on the front lines of COVID-19.   Mahalo nui loa to you all for the sacrifices you’ve made battling this pandemic. Your dedication, commitment and courage deserve our deepest gratitude.    https://t.co/2vNOuRmiFE

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Our response to COVID-19 has always been driven by the need to protect the safety of our residents and our community. The pre-travel testing program allows us to do this while welcoming more people to our state. The increased economic activity will help strengthen our communities

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Today I signed a 13th supplementary emergency proclamation that extends the COVID-19 emergency period through Oct. 31.   https://t.co/JAzv8cPZOo

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Today I announced a new leadership team that will oversee the state’s public health response to #COVID19 and the pre-travel testing program for COVID-19, which will start October 15. Read more:   https://t.co/Kd4PNsS6Gc

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic and its financial impacts have affected renters across the state. This program provides essential support directly to help those most at-risk and in need. We are grateful to be partnering with Aloha United Way and Catholic Charities Hawai‘i.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: Dr. Bruce Anderson and Director Nolan Espinda will be retiring in September. Both directors have served admirably under extremely challenging conditions, especially since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.   https://t.co/PP00WkqDa4

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: We've taken measures in recent weeks to address the surge in #COVID cases. Although we’ve seen a leveling off in cases on Oʻahu, they’re still too high & our healthcare system is still at risk. #FlattenTheCurve  Read the full news release at:  https://t.co/sLBnE832PR

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: This will bring relief to many who are still unemployed due to the impact of the coronavirus on our economy. I’m taking this action to maximize all available federal funds to help people in Hawaiʻi who are unemployed because of COVID-19.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: I urge you to make an appointment with your physicians for routine checkups and vaccinations. Health officials warn that there are many other diseases that can threaten your health, and that people with chronic diseases are more vulnerable to serious illness from COVID-19.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: The state @DOTHawaii will require thermal screening at the airport for everyone traveling inter-island. HDOT will also require travelers to fill out a new form that'll now also ask for health-related info to assist the state in tracking and responding to new COVID-19 cases.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: The Lt. Governor is not banned from news conferences and meetings. In this new COVID-19 reality, we are reinventing the way state government conducts business while implementing appropriate social distancing in meetings, news conferences and other activities.  https://t.co/fm0LkKuEKM

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: I commend and fully support the Hawaiʻi Department of Education (DOE) for furthering the state’s efforts to implement social distancing. These are challenging decisions being made every day across the state but are essential to help mitigate the spread of COVID-19.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: They have my full support and commitment to continue to work cooperatively as we move forward in our efforts to fight COVID-19.

name: Governor David Ige
tweet: •For both the utilities and essential services, government resources and support can be deployed as necessary. •The one-week waiting period for unemployment insurance benefits is waived for those unemployed because of COVID-19.
